question: 天井
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>heaven</kanji> <kanji>well</kanji> is the well that goes up into the heavens. This is above you, and it is a <vocabulary>ceiling</vocabulary>. Maybe the "well" part is referring to the chimney that goes up through the ceiling to the heavens when you look up in a super old house?
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. Be careful of the rendaku.
